required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Myofascial Induction Effects on Stabilometry Versus Sham Laser
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Myofascial Induction Technique in Stabilometry Plantar Fascia Compared to a Placebo Laser

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to determine the effectiveness of myofascial induction effects on stabilometric variables. Forty healthy subjects will be recruited for a single blind clinical trial. All subjects will be randomly distributed into two different groups: control group (simulated laser) and experimental group (myofascial induction). Result measurements will be performed in the center of the pressure area (stabilometry) using a validated platform. Two trials will be recorded for each condition (eyes closed and eyes open)

primary_outcome.measure: Stabilometry variable eyes open before Sham Laser or Myofascial Induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Stabilometry assessment was used and subjects were instructed to stand barefoot on the force platform, participants were instructed to remain in a relaxed standing posture with feet shoulder-width apart and positioned at 30º from the midline. Stabilometric variables measure the displacement of the center of pressures in X (in millimeters) with the eyes open.

primary_outcome.measure: Stabilometry variables eyes open before Sham Laser or Myofascial indution
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Stabilometry assessment was used and subjects were instructed to stand barefoot on the force platform, participants were instructed to remain in a relaxed standing posture with feet shoulder-width apart and positioned 30º from the midline. The stabilometry variables measure the displacement of the center of pressures in Y (in millimeters) with the eyes open.

primary_outcome.measure: Stabilometry variables eyes open before Sham Laser or Myofascial indution
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Stabilometry assessment was used and subjects were instructed to stand barefoot on the force platform, participants were instructed to remain in a relaxed standing posture with feet shoulder-width apart and positioned at 30º away from the midline. Stabilometry variables measure displacement of the center of Pressure (COP) area (in millimeters²) with eyes open.

primary_outcome.measure: Stabilometry variables eyes open before Sham Laser or Myofascial indution
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Stabilometry assessment was used and subjects were instructed to stand barefoot on the force platform, participants were instructed to remain in a relaxed standing posture with feet shoulder-width apart and positioned 30º from the midline. Stabilometric variables measure the center of pressure and the velocity displacement of the anteroposterior direction (a-p) (in millimeters / second).

primary_outcome.measure: Stabilometry variables eyes open before Sham Laser or Myofascial indution
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Stabilometry assessment was used and subjects were instructed to stand barefoot on the force platform, participants were instructed to remain in a relaxed standing posture with feet shoulder-width apart and positioned 30º from the midline. Stabilometric variables measure center of pressure, velocity, and lateral-lateral (lat-lat) direction displacement (in millimeters / second).

arm_group.description: Placebo laser application in plantar fascia
Myofascial Induction technique application in plantar fascia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy individuals without pain.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous lower extremities surgery
- History of lower extremities injury with residual symptoms within the last year
- Evidence of a leg-length discrepancy of more than 1 cm
- Evidence of balance deficits

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Podiatry, Principal Investigator, and Physiotherapist
